sen.j: 重祚（ちょうそ）とは、一度退位した皇帝が再び践祚（せんそ：皇帝に即位すること）することをいう。
sen.e: Choso means reaccession of retired emperors to the throne.

sen.j: 現在までに重祚した天皇は二人で、皇極天皇が斉明天皇として、孝謙天皇が孝謙天皇称徳天皇として、それぞれ重祚している。
sen.e: Two emperors performed choso in the past; Emperor Kogyoku ascended the throne a second time as Emperor Saimei and Emperor Koken ascended the throne a second time as Emperor Shotoku.

sen.e: Emperor Kogyoku stalled for time due to political speculation of his son Emperor Tenchi.

sen.j: なお、後醍醐天皇が元弘の乱によって隠岐諸島に流罪となり、かわって光厳天皇（現在では北朝 (日本)天皇とされている）が即位したものの、後に隠岐を脱出し帰京した後醍醐天皇によって光厳天皇の即位は否定された。
sen.e: Emperor Godaigo was exiled to the Oki Islands in the Genko War and Emperor Kogon (currently the Northern Court (Japan) Emperor) ascended the throne, but Emperor Godaigo who escaped from the Oki Islands and came back to Kyoto denied the enthronement of Emperor Kogon.

sen.e: In China, Busokuten enthroned in Tang and a nation was founded (Busokuten) in the end of the 7th to the beginning of the 8th century, and Jungjong (Tang) and Yejong (Tang) were dethroned by Busokuten.

sen.e: When Goryeo in the end of the 13th century to the middle of the 14th century came under the rule of Yuan (Dynasty), the throne was transferred to a crown prince or restored in line with the wishes of the Yuan imperial court.
